# Arpeggio: Major 7th in B (Shape: G) 

An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played in succession, rather than simultaneously. In this case, we are looking at a Major 7th arpeggio in the key of B, using the G shape on the guitar.

## Notes and Intervals:
- B (Root)
- D# (Major 3rd)
- F# (Perfect 5th)
- A# (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
This Major 7th arpeggio in B, using the G shape, has a lush and jazzy sound to it. Major 7th chords and arpeggios are often used in jazz, bossa nova, and other related genres to convey a sense of sophistication and complexity in the music. The Major 7th quality gives the arpeggio a dreamy and introspective flavor, which can add a touch of elegance to any piece of music.

This jazz standard prominently features Major 7th chords and arpeggios, creating a melancholic and contemplative atmosphere.
